spec.displayName: Connecting Kafka topics to a Quarkus application
spec.description: In this tutorial, you will set up a Kafka instance and create topics to be used with a Quarkus application
spec.introduction: We will be using Apache Kafka, an open-source distributed event streaming platform used by thousands of companies for high-performance data pipelines, streaming analytics, data integration, and mission-critical applications.
prerequisites: Red Hat Streams for Apache Kafka

form.title: The following information is required before we can get started

fields.name: openshift
fields.label: Your OpenShift URL
fields.helperText: Need OpenShift? Create a sandbox environment here - https://developers.redhat.com/developer-sandbox

fields.name: kafka
fields.label: URL to Application Services -> Streams for Apache Kafka
fields.helperText: Streams for Apache Kafka is offered as part of Application Services and can be found at https://cloud.redhat.com

tasks.title: Kafka
tasks.description:
In this step, you will create a Kafka instance and connect topics to them.

Click on the Launch RHOSAK button to launch Red Hat OpenShift Streams for Apache Kafka. Once launched, follow the quick start within it.

Launch RHOSAK

Verification

  1. Did you create a Kafka instance?

  2. Did you create a Kafka topic?

tasks.title: Connecting kafka to OpenShift
tasks.description:
Now that you’ve set up a kafka with topics, you’ll be connecting that to an application that you create on OpenShift.

Click on the Launch OpenShift button to launch Red Hat OpenShift Streams for Apache Kafka. Once launched, follow the quick start within it.

Launch OpenShift

Verification

  1. Did you create a quarkus app?

  2. Did you connect a Kafka topic to it?

Congratulations! You successfully completed the quick start.

spec.conclusion: Congratulations! You successfully completed the quick start.
